page.title: 12RECREATION IN EDGEFIELD
page.content: Young people tend to seek their entertainment outside the village, in Holt, Sheringham or Cromer, or at discos in Melton Constable, but they are hampered by lack of transport. Older people go to the Tuesday Club and other events at the village hall. The football field between Rectory Road and Limekiln Lane was given to the village in 1914. It is now used by the employees of Bernard Matthews plc, turkey breeders, who own several farms close to our area. The public house must also appear under this heading: it provides simple meals and is a free house (i.e. not attached to any particular brewery). It is now called 'The three pigs': it used to be 'The Bacon arms'- an example of Norfolk humour?
